meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! I'm here to give you the lowdown on Men of War II, and let me tell you, this game is a real treat for those who love 'em some RTS action. Now, I know what you're thinking - what's with all these numbers and words from other critics? Well, buckle up, Buttercup, because we're diving into the review pool to see what the experts have to say!

So, SpazioGames gives it a solid 77, saying it's a deep game despite some UI flaws. Yeah, no kidding - I had trouble figuring out where my tanks were hiding in the first place! COGconnected chimes in with an 78, praising the game for its depth and complexity, but warning that getting there takes time. Yeah, I got lost in the tutorial... again.

3DJuegos gives it a "Recommended" stamp (whatever that means), while PC Gamer says it's a "flawed but rewarding gem" for masochistic RTS fans. Okay, okay, I get it - this game is not for the faint of heart!

Cubed3 dings it with a 60, citing clunky controls and complicated gameplay. Yeah, I felt like I was trying to herd cats sometimes! But hey, at least they acknowledged the always-online requirement (yikes!).

GameSpew gives it a 70, praising its realism, depth, and freedom to explore your own strategies. Yeah, once you get the hang of things, this game can be pretty addictive!

And finally, IGN Italia gives it an impressive 80, calling it "astoundingly deep" and offering a unique experience in WWII simulation. Well, I'll be - maybe I'm just not masochistic enough to appreciate its flaws!

All right, all right - that's my two cents on Men of War II. Is it for you? Only if you enjoy a good challenge, folks!
